discussion.p: Allocator, since pointer is required to be convertible to value_type*, the required convertibility to void* is superfluous. Ditto for const_pointer to const void *. Also, there is a typo in requires Convertible<const_pointer, const value_type&>. Should be requires Convertible<const_pointer, const value_type*>.
In specification of Allocator::construct just above 20.1.3 para 11, error requires Constructible<value_type, V&&> should be requires Convertible<V, value_type> as in the synopsis.
